span.p: IMPORTANT INFORMATION: In line with the Governor's Executive Order, all Marana schools are closed through end of school year. Read information on our Coronavirus Webpage.

a.title: Go to comments for Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)

span.p: Learning at Home: Beginning Monday, March 30, through school closure, learning at home officially begins, as required in HB 2910.

a.title: Go to comments for Learning at Home

span.p: Grab & Go Meals: FREE Grab & Go Meals at schools, along bus routes, and Marana Cares Mobile! Monday-Friday. Free to ALL children 18 and under.

a.title: Go to comments for Grab & Go Meals

span.p: SpeakUp Safety Tip Line: Use SpeakUp safety tip line to email, call, text concerns of bullying, threats of violence, weapons brought to school, planned fights, students in crisis, and other urgent situations. Link to https://www.maranausd.org/Domain/3836

a.title: Go to comments for SpeakUp Safety Tip Line

span.p: Get Our App: Download the new MUSD free mobile App! School & District news in the palm of your hand!

a.title: Go to comments for MUSD mobile App

span.p: District-Wide Awards & Recognitions: Check out the exciting Awards & Recognitions section for all of our schools, or visit the home page of your school to get breaking news and awards!

a.title: Go to comments for District-Wide Awards & Recognitions

span.p: Together No Student Goes Hungry! Working together, we can ensure no student goes hungry. Your generous tax-deductible donation makes a difference!

a.title: Go to comments for Together No Student Goes Hungry!

span.p: TAX CREDIT: Support Marana student with a dollar for dollar tax credit and reduce what you owe in State taxes (up to $400!). Give throughout the year, or all at once! Make a difference today!

a.title: Go to comments for Tax Credit

span.p: Help Ensure Students Don’t Go Hungry on Weekends when Shopping at Fry's: Families can now contribute to MUSD's Power Pack Program through the Fry's Community Rewards Program, to benefit Power Pack. Power Packs ensure children have access to food during weekends and school breaks; resulting in fewer stomach aches and greater ability to learn.

a.title: Go to comments for Power Pack Program with Fry's

img.title: Dr. Doug Wilson
img.alt: Dr. Doug Wilson

p.img: On behalf of our staff and Governing Board, I welcome you and thank you for your interest in the Marana Unified School District. It is our honor to serve the children in our community. It is also a privilege to be a part of a school district consisting of remarkable staff, a dedicated Governing Board, invested parents, and caring community and business members all of whom are committed to the well-being of our students.

span.p: The Marana Unified School District is an integral part of the community and we take pride in knowing that the District is one of the reasons families choose to live in the Marana area. Our schools are dedicated to providing safe, secure and nurturing environments that facilitate and enhance student achievement and success. We are confident that we have a very special and educationally enriching experience to offer the children in our community.

It is our belief that we must vigorously seek opportunities to engage students in the most relevant learning opportunities possible in order to prepare them for the demands of the future. Our children deserve no less than the best and our teachers, staff, and administrators are committed to providing the highest quality education so our students become lifelong learners and responsible citizens.

I invite parents and community members to become actively involved in a student’s school experience. Home, community, and school partnerships, founded on mutual respect and regular communication, provide an unbeatable combination for quality education and student success.
I invite you to learn more about our District by visiting any of our schools or contacting our District office.

span.p: In accordance with A.R.S. §15-903(E), as amended by Laws 2018, Ch. 285, §10, a local educational agency's (LEA) budget must include the prominent display of the average salary of all teachers employed by the district or charter for the budget and prior years, and the increase in the average salary of all teachers employed by the district or charter for the budget year reported in dollars and percentage.
AVERAGE TEACHER SALARIES (A.R.S. §15-903.E, amended by Laws 2018, Ch. 285, §10)

ol.li: Average salary of all teachers employed in FY 2020 (budget year) $46,755
Average salary of all teachers employed in FY 2019 (prior year) $44,529
Increase in average teacher salary from the prior year $2,226

span.p: Average teacher salary are teaching positions coded to 1000 functions and 6112 object code. Total budgeted salaries divided by Full Time Equivalence. Classroom Site Fund base pay allocation, override amounts and previous year stipends for Instructional Improvement and PBP payment dollars are included. Important to note, the 15% teachers received was given only to their base pay, so must consider all other funds did not receive the 15% increase. Second consideration is attrition.
